Reviews.Content: Charming, great service and location Stayed for the weekend in this charming hotel. I chose this hotel because it looked charming, centrally located at the same time easy to get to from the ring road. You can park your car for a few minutes in front of the hotel when you arrive and check in. Then they will call the garage to pick it up. When you enter the city center, you will see street cameras because the zone is ZTL zona traficco limitato - the hotel will take your plate number and they will call the ZTL authorities to cancel your 'ticket' for entering the city. The 24 hour parking is about 25Euros which is standard for most Florence central hotels, you can extend for a few hours where they charge about an additional 2.5Euro per hour. Our room was nicely decorated - like an old palazzo and we had a view of the cathedral. I liked the interior of the breakfast room as well, breakfast was basic. The most I liked about this hotel was the service staff. They were also very nice to let us keep our room free of charge until 3PM since it was still the low season. If you are sensitive to noise, do ask for a room at the back, you wont get a view but it will shield you from the street noise and from the bar across the street. Regarding the 'smell' in the elevator foyer from other reviews, it never bothered us as it was hardly noticeable. If I had not read the reviews, I wouldnt even know it was there. Location was also great, right beside the duomo, close to everything. Overall, great value, nice experience.
Reviews.Author: joyful_sun

Reviews.Content: Good enough for the price The entrance is through the ground floor of an office building that smells very bad. You should take the elevator to go to the third floor, where is really the entrance of this small hotel.The rooms and breakfast are good enough for the price. The noise is terrible, specially for the rooms with views to the street. Main advantage: just at 100 meters of the Cathedral.
Reviews.Author: PABLOGONZALEZ

Reviews.Content: Great location but noisy street       View of Duomo from room
Reviews.Author: TheVirginian

Reviews.Content: Filthy- don't go here Dirty dirty dirty, no pillows and stains of I-don't - want to know what it was- really--Horrible. Disgusting. What else can I add. Don't go here. DON''T. the internet site was so different it looked lovely- worst hotel I've ever been in my whole life
Reviews.Author: fabioolli

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Brillian Location       View from room to Baptistry
Reviews.Author: Willowchilla

Reviews.Content: Fabulous Hotel and Location! And, a bargain! In September 2004 I booked a trip to Florence for myself and my 11 year old niece. I found a great package which was ridiculously affordable and was given a choice of hotels. While the Palazzo Ruspoli was not rated as highly as a few of the other hotels offered, I was amazed at the photos of the rooms on the Internet and the location was perfect. Having traveled through Europe a great deal, most often to Paris (home of the tiny hotel room), I was a bit skeptical but I had made my decision. When we arrived at The Palazzo Ruspoli I was truly worried when we had to enter through the lobby of an office building. But, exiting the elevator, I was more than pleasantly surprised. The desk staff were charming, and showed us to our room almost immediately This was unusual as we had arrived at the hotel several hours prior to the normal check in time. We had flown in from the U.S. and needed to drop our luggage before heading off to explore the riches of Florence and the hotel staff were more than accommodating. Our room was just to the left of the front desk and had a double door to insure a quiet rest. The room was stunning. Beautifully appointed with matching draperies, bedding and pillows. A small desk for writing, and small closet. I will admit, the closet could be larger by 100%, but we were only there for four nights. The bath was also a bit tight as we are not small people, but rather tall. The shower was tiny, but I feel when traveling, there are some things you just put up with. After all, I was not staying at a fancy hotel and if I want all the comforts of home, I stay home. I am not sure what the others who have posted are referring to when they say it was noisy. The windows are double glazed and there are room darkening/noise absorbing curtains. We heard nothing at night and in fact, slept with the window ajar for fresh air. The breakfast was perfect and a great way to being the day. I am used to staying in Parisian hotels where breakfast is usually a broiche and espresso in a caf茅 on the street, so this was a treat. My niece who is also rather well traveled truly enjoyed this hotel. In fact, she enjoyed everything about Florence and was a real adventurer on the entire trip. The location could not be more perfect. Directly out the front door are major bus lines and the Duomo and Baptistry are less than a 30 second walk. Everything in Florence that one would want to see is less than a 15 minute walk. I had been to Florence before and this was by far the best location and lodging I have encountered. Bravissimo!I was so fond of the Palazzo Ruspoli that this coming September I have rented a villa with a group of friends and will need to stay in Florence for one night at the beginning of the trip and one night at the end of the trip and I will book with the Palazzo Ruspoli.
Reviews.Author: Tamara

Reviews.Content: great location - ok hotel greal location less than a block from the Duomo and within walking distance of everything. the location is a little weird, you have to push through crowds waiting for the bus in front of the door to get in. yes, it is noisy if you want to nap at 2 PM - but we had no trouble sleeping at night. Room and bathroom were ok, really what we would expect. the combination of price and location make it a good value. Next time we would probably stay a few blocks further away from the Duomo since getting around town is so easy.
Reviews.Author: yankel

Reviews.Content: Great location near the Duomo, but... The hotel itself is very nice, and you can almost reach out and touch the Duomo from its 3rd floor location, but if you have a problem with noise, this is not the hotel for you. The rooms in the front of the hotel are above a busy street with buses, ambulances and people going by all night long. Also, there is a bar open until 2am directly across the street. It is impossible to sleep with the windows open. If you do stay here, request a room with an actual shower. Our bathroom had a drain in the middle of the floor with accordian type doors. Since there was no shower pan, the bathroom flooded immediately.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Really great hotel       Here's the hubby conked out in our lovely room
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel for the price Stay at this hotel in October of 2004. Very good location as close to most of the attractions of Florence. Room was clean and large with high ceiling. Street noises could be heard at night from the room. Bathroom was very old however. Staff was very friendly. Overall, it was a nice place to stay for the price. No smell of the entrance as mentioned by the other reviews.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Visit the Duomo without leaving your room! I thought this hotel was fantastic. The room was clean and exactly as promised, the view of the Duomo was outstanding, the desk staff were helpful, and the location was perfect - right in the middle of Florence! I would stay here again and recommend it to all my friends.The hotel has some tradeoffs which I was willing to make:The noise on the street was loud (but worth the view, close the window and shades or bring earplugs if you are really sensitive)There is an odor upon entering (due to a sewer drain in the entranceway, no smell in the room at all)The hotel is not staffed from 9pm - 7am (hotel down the block is staffed, but you must take your room key with you to go out at night)Front door is next to a bus stop so you often have to push through a crowd of people to get in and out of your door (of course you also have the easy access to a bus stop)
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Palazzo Ruspoli 2005 Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March 2005 - fantastic location - we could see the Duomo from our window and everything was on our doorstep. Very clean hotel. Only problem - ensure you get a room at the back! Our room overlooked a bus stop  bar across the road - at night it got very noisy. Asked reception if we could change room and unfortunately they only have 2 rooms at the back which were occupied. Other than that well worth the money - would definitely return (to a room at the back!!)
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Traffic Noise Unbearable We stayed at Palazzo Ruspoli for three nights last month, May 2004. We booked through the internet after viewing photos of the hotel rooms. We were very disappointed as our room looked nothing like the photos, nor did the hallway. Upon arrival, the entrance of the hotel had a offensive odor that did not disappear during our stay. Held our breath when entering and using the elevator. Our room was a good size, but sparsely furnished. The room faced the street above the bus stop. The noise was unbearable, even with the windows closed. Did not sleep the first night, but through exhaustion fitfully slept the second  third nights. If you stay here, make sure you do not get a room on the street side. Location is great - near everything. The staff were cordial and nice. The breakfast room looked like the photo on the internet and was nice. We would not stay at this hotel again due to the odor and noise level from the street (buses, street cleaners, mopeds, etc.).
Reviews.Author: Rinette

Reviews.Content: very good hotel good situation in fact a good adress We were very happy to find this hotel where we had a nice room.The person at the reception was very helpfull and he gave us a room at the back as we asked really we find this really professionnalmerci beaucoup
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fine Hotel This hotel is in a great location right by the Duomo and in walking distance of all the other sights of Florence. The hotel staff were very friendly, efficient and informative, the rooms were very spacious and comfortable and the breakfast set us up for the day ahead. It can be a bit noisy but after walking round Florence all day it did not affect my nights sleep. I would definitely recommend this place.
Reviews.Author: PSCOR

Reviews.Content: Great location My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in late September. The hotel has an excellent location, just a half block from the Doumo, and central to all the major Florence sites. Our room was nice size, nicely decorated. If travelling in the summer, be sure to ask for air-conditioning, otherwise the traffic noise from an open window is too much. The bathroom was fine, nothing special, not much counter space, but adequate. The breakfast was better than some places - meats, cheese, cereal, rolls, juice and coffee. All in all, I think I would stay here again; don't expect luxury, rather just a nice place with an excellent location.
Reviews.Author: kittykai
